availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Lester (Caldwell co., ky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Lester and Cinderella Lester. Licensed to marry Mary Jane Purdy Lester in Princeton, Kentucky, on December 7, 1852. Father of Eliza Lester, Samuel Lester, Francis Lester, Ebb Dick Lester, Richard S. Lester, Robert J. Lester, and Sidney J. Lester. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Long Pond in 1860. Employed George Moneymaker as a farm laborer in Long Pond in 1860. Held one enslaved person in trust in Long Pond in 1860.
